pageContext.claim: “The economy is growing at twice the rate it did under Obama.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump appears to be comparing his high-water-mark 4.2 percent GDP growth in the second quarter of 2018 with average quarterly growth of 1.9 percent for the entire eight years of the Obama administration. That's not a good comparison, because third quarter growth this year slowed to 3.5 percent -- and growth exceeded 4 percent at several points during Obama's presidency and reached 5.1 percent in the second quarter of 2014. The average for Trump's presidency so far is 2.8 percent, which is not twice Obama's average.
